bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v. King County. Case Summary.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: United States of America Territory of Washington County of King ss.
United States vs James McGarth and William Herbert Complaint Charge of Counterfiting
div1.p: MV Mills being duly sworn on oath says that on or about the 17th day of March A.D. 1880 in the County of King, Territory of Washington United States of America, James McGarth and William Herbert did falsey make forge and counterfit coin in the similitude of gold on silver coin, coined and stamped at the mint and assay offices of the United States, which gold or silver coin currit in the United States and an in actual circulation and the thereof, and that the said James McGarth and William Herbert did pass utter and publish such counterfit and payed coin Knowingly think to to each at the time and place aforesaid with intent to do fraud, James Eaton, F.W Wald, T Briar, Jacob Ben Robert Bayer, F.W. Wastenhoff, A. How, contrary to the statues of the United States.
div1.ab: Sworn + subscribed to before me this 22nd day of March 1880
United States vs James McGarth and William Herbert Complaint Filed March 22nd 1880 James P. Ludlow US Commissioner
